auto_merge.commit_message:
Problem: No way to check the version of a treesitter parser.

Solution: Add version metadata (ABI 15 parsers only) as well as parser state count and supertype information (ABI 15) in `vim.treesitter.language.inspect()`. Also graduate the `abi_version` field, as this is now the official upstream name.

---------

Co-authored-by: Christian Clason <c.clason@uni-graz.at>

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Added `metadata`, `supertypes` and `state_count`.

```
{
  _abi_version = 15,
  _wasm = false,
  fields = { "alternative", "argument", ..., "value" },
  metadata = {
    major_version = 0,
    minor_version = 23,
    patch_version = 4
  },
  state_count = 2015,
  supertypes = {
    _abstract_declarator = { "abstract_array_declarator", "abstract_function_declarator", "abstract_parenthesized_declarator", "abstract_pointer_declarator" },
    _declarator = { "array_declarator", "attributed_declarator", "function_declarator", "identifier", "parenthesized_declarator", "pointer_declarator" },
    _field_declarator = { "field_identifier", "function_declarator", "function_declarator", "array_declarator", "array_declarator", "array_declarator", "attributed_declarator", "attributed_declarator", "attributed_declarator", "function_declarator", "function_declarator", "function_declarator", "parenthesized_declarator", "parenthesized_declarator", "parenthesized_declarator", "pointer_declarator", "pointer_declarator", "pointer_declarator" },
    _type_declarator = { "type_identifier", "function_declarator", "function_declarator", "array_declarator", "array_declarator", "array_declarator", "attributed_declarator", "attributed_declarator", "attributed_declarator", "function_declarator", "function_declarator", "function_declarator", "parenthesized_declarator", "parenthesized_declarator", "parenthesized_declarator", "pointer_declarator", "pointer_declarator", "pointer_declarator", "primitive_type" },
    expression = { "alignof_expression", "assignment_expression", "binary_expression", "call_expression", "cast_expression", "char_literal", "compound_literal_expression", "concatenated_string", "conditional_expression", "extension_expression", "false", "field_expression", "generic_expression", "gnu_asm_expression", "identifier", "null", "number_literal", "offsetof_expression", "parenthesized_expression", "pointer_expression", "sizeof_expression", "string_literal", "subscript_expression", "true", "unary_expression", "update_expression" },
    statement = { "attributed_statement", "break_statement", "case_statement", "compound_statement", "continue_statement", "do_statement", "expression_statement", "for_statement", "goto_statement", "if_statement", "labeled_statement", "return_statement", "seh_leave_statement", "seh_try_statement", "switch_statement", "while_statement" },
    type_specifier = { "type_identifier", "enum_specifier", "macro_type_specifier", "primitive_type", "sized_type_specifier", "struct_specifier", "union_specifier" }
  },
  symbols = {
    ['"\n"'] = false,
    ['"!"'] = false,
    ...
    unary_expression = true,
    union_specifier = true,
    update_expression = true,
    variadic_parameter = true,
    while_statement = true
  }
}
```

comment_data.body: Why mark these as private (underscore)? Presumably this is a stable API from upstream.

The _input_ we get (from upstream `ts_language_metadata`) is, but the _output_ (from _our_ `_ts_inspect_language`) is not. This is the output here. 

Maybe we shouldn't use the `_ts` prefix here if it's not an actual upstream API, to make this clearer?
Happy to bikeshed this if anyone wants to expose this differently.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -26,6 +26,9 @@ error('Cannot require a meta file')
 ---@field symbols table<string,boolean>
 ---@field _wasm boolean
 ---@field _abi_version integer
+---@field _major_version? integer
+---@field _minor_version? integer
+---@field _patch_version? integer

comment_data.body:
If it's not much trouble, probably should be a `version` structure with `version.major`/`version.minor`/`version.patch`.

Or if this is internal-only then ignore this comment.
Here we are just passing through the upstream `metadata` struct (which right now only has these three fields but may add more in the future).
Are these fields documented anywhere? Else it might be helpful to add descriptions.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -24,6 +24,11 @@ error('Cannot require a meta file')
 ---@class TSLangInfo
 ---@field fields string[]
 ---@field symbols table<string,boolean>
+---@field major_version? integer
+---@field minor_version? integer
+---@field patch_version? integer
+---@field state_count integer

comment_data.body:
Added some brief explanation. Version should be obvious, while state count and supertypes are "expert information" -- either you know what they mean or the information is meaningless anyway.

(And the treesitter docs are in sore need of overhaul, but that has to wait until we are closer to being stable.)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -24,6 +24,11 @@ error('Cannot require a meta file')
 ---@class TSLangInfo
 ---@field fields string[]
 ---@field symbols table<string,boolean>
+---@field major_version? integer
+---@field minor_version? integer
+---@field patch_version? integer
+---@field state_count integer

comment_regular_data.body: Hierarchical nodes; the nodes `foo/bar` and `foo/baz` both have "supertype" `foo` and can be captured as `(foo)`.
Is there an example? C doesn't have any.
I think it does; they all have: https://github.com/tree-sitter/tree-sitter-c/blob/2a265d69a4caf57108a73ad2ed1e6922dd2f998c/grammar.js#L72-L80
I don't think the API is working then as it's returning a length of `0`.

May want to punt then. If we _do_ expose it, I think it should be as a table
```lua
{
  supertype1 = { subtype1, ... },
  supertype2 = { subtype1, ... },
}
```
(using `ts_language_subtypes`).
Ok commented out for now. Need a parser that actually has them to develop further.

> I don't think the API is working then as it's returning a length of `0`.

It's working, but you need ABI 15 for that -- also for the language. Try `:TSInstallFromGrammar c` and test again.

(Chicken and egg situation...)
The latest release is for `492f7aaa`, is that new enough?
I've built tree-sitter-c from `492f7aaa` using tree-sitter 0.25.2 and can't see them

> I've built tree-sitter-c from `492f7aaa` using tree-sitter 0.25.2 and can't see them

Just to be clear (for those following at home): you have to _(re)generate_ `tree-sitter-c` using tree-sitter 0.25.x first, otherwise you'll still build the committed ABI 14 `parser.c`.

> Just to be clear (for those following at home): you have to (re)generate tree-sitter-c using tree-sitter 0.25.x first, otherwise you'll still build the committed ABI 14 parser.c.

Yeah I did all that. It was a runtimepath issue; the core parser had priority.

All works now, supertypes and subtypes.

```
{
  _abi_version = 15,
  _wasm = false,
  fields = { "alternative", "argument", ..., "value" },
  metadata = {
    major_version = 0,
    minor_version = 23,
    patch_version = 4
  },
  state_count = 2015,
  supertypes = {
    _abstract_declarator = { "abstract_array_declarator", "abstract_function_declarator", "abstract_parenthesized_declarator", "abstract_pointer_declarator" },
    _declarator = { "array_declarator", "attributed_declarator", "function_declarator", "identifier", "parenthesized_declarator", "pointer_declarator" },
    _field_declarator = { "field_identifier", "function_declarator", "function_declarator", "array_declarator", "array_declarator", "array_declarator", "attributed_declarator", "attributed_declarator", "attributed_declarator", "function_declarator", "function_declarator", "function_declarator", "parenthesized_declarator", "parenthesized_declarator", "parenthesized_declarator", "pointer_declarator", "pointer_declarator", "pointer_declarator" },
    _type_declarator = { "type_identifier", "function_declarator", "function_declarator", "array_declarator", "array_declarator", "array_declarator", "attributed_declarator", "attributed_declarator", "attributed_declarator", "function_declarator", "function_declarator", "function_declarator", "parenthesized_declarator", "parenthesized_declarator", "parenthesized_declarator", "pointer_declarator", "pointer_declarator", "pointer_declarator", "primitive_type" },
    expression = { "alignof_expression", "assignment_expression", "binary_expression", "call_expression", "cast_expression", "char_literal", "compound_literal_expression", "concatenated_string", "conditional_expression", "extension_expression", "false", "field_expression", "generic_expression", "gnu_asm_expression", "identifier", "null", "number_literal", "offsetof_expression", "parenthesized_expression", "pointer_expression", "sizeof_expression", "string_literal", "subscript_expression", "true", "unary_expression", "update_expression" },
    statement = { "attributed_statement", "break_statement", "case_statement", "compound_statement", "continue_statement", "do_statement", "expression_statement", "for_statement", "goto_statement", "if_statement", "labeled_statement", "return_statement", "seh_leave_statement", "seh_try_statement", "switch_statement", "while_statement" },
    type_specifier = { "type_identifier", "enum_specifier", "macro_type_specifier", "primitive_type", "sized_type_specifier", "struct_specifier", "union_specifier" }
  },
  symbols = {
    ['"\n"'] = false,
    ['"!"'] = false,
    ...
    unary_expression = true,
    union_specifier = true,
    update_expression = true,
    variadic_parameter = true,
    while_statement = true
  }
}
```

Since this information is passed through to `vim.treesitter.language.inspect()`, this may actually merit a news entry (mentioning that this only applies to ABI 15 parsers, since only they have that information -- e.g., "`|vim.treesitter.language.inspect()|` shows parser version and supertypes for ABI 15 parsers").

Rationale: more visibility for parser versioning will hopefully drive quicker adoption.

(Even though it's exposed, we should still expose the `metadata` as-is and not repackage it. May want to un-underscore `_abi_version`, as that is a standard upstream field -- beware that this requires a small adaptation to the `vim.treesitter` health check.)

Related follow-up (not in this PR): Allow passing a `parser` (filename) to `vim.treesitter.language.inspect()` for diagnostic purposes?

Otherwise LGTM.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: feat: add more metadata to _ts_inspect_language()
